page.title: 01LOCAL NEWS.
page.content: Local news stories in the Burntwood area during May,June 1985. Chase Terrace Nursery School celebrated arrival of their 1,000th pupil.The 7 year old nursery asked their 1st pupil to plant a tree in celebration and organised the planting of 1,000 flowers. Local residents have been asked for their opinion on a proposed Motorway running through the south of Chasewater leading on to the A5 at Ogley Hay Road. St.Matthew's psychiatric hospital may suffer from rundown wards.An estimated 450 patients are to attend the hospital in the next 20 years during which time 5 million pounds will need to be spent. Martin and Deborah Owen were given awards for coming runners-up in Lichfield Bower Superstars.
